Paul James <paul@...> writes:

> Why would I POST it to /piratesofthecarribean/chapter17? Surely that is 
> a resource of it's own, one that represents chapter 17, so if I wanted 
> to update chapter 17 I should PUT my new representation of it.
>
> Similarly, if I wanted to dub the film into Spanish, I could GET 
> /piratesofthecarribean/dialogue, get my voice actors to record a new 
> version in Spanish, and then PUT it back to 
> /piratesofthecarribean/dialogue. The fact that it is a part of a larger 
> whole is irrelevant from an API standpoint. Correct?

Correct.

My point was about the management of large resources.

If you are concerned about the efficiencies of passing large
representations around when you edit them you can simply construct
another set of resources over the existing resource that allows finer
grained editing.


Splitting a film into chapters (like a DVD) is one way of doing
it. But of course there are millions of others, one of them being the
way you suggest.
